qas.question: In what competition did the Samoan rugby team reach the quarter finals in 2013?
Apart from Australia, in what country other than Samoa might Samoan rugby players live?
What Samoan rugby player signed to London Irish rugby club?
How many teams played in the 2011 domestic Samoan rugby league competition?
What rugby club did Maurie Fa'asavalu play for?

plausible_answers.text: made of players playing in the NRL, Super League and domestic players

qas.question: What players made up the British rugby team in 2013?
How many teams played in the 2013 Rugby League World Cup?
What rugby club did Francis Meli sign with in 2012?
How many teams will the NRL expand to have in 2012?

context: <b5_0>Rugby league<b5_0/> is mostly played by Samoans living in <a1_0>New Zealand<a1_0/> and Australia,[citation needed] with Samoa reaching the quarter finals of the 2013 <a0_0>Rugby League World Cup<a0_0/> <b6_0>made of players playing in the NRL, Super League and domestic players<b6_0/>. Many Samoans and New Zealanders or Australians of Samoan descent play in the Super League and National Leagues in Britain. Francis Meli, Ta'ane Lavulavu of Workington Town, Maurie Fa'asavalu of <a4_0>St Helens<a4_0/> and David Fatialofa of Whitehaven and <a2_0>Setima Sa<a2_0/> who signed with <b8_0>London Irish rugby club<b8_0/>. Other noteworthy players from NZ and Australia have represented the Samoan National team. The 2011 domestic Samoan rugby league competition contained <a3_0><b7_0>10<b7_0/><a3_0/> teams with plans to expand to <b9_0>12<b9_0/> in 2012.
